page.title: 16Visit to the Cinema in EK
page.content: The cinema in East Kilbride is part of the Town Centre complex and is therefore very handy to reach by bus, while the many car parks mean there are no problems for those who travel by car. Being in a New Town it is a fairly modern building and like many other local cinemas it has been con- verted from one large theatre to two smaller ones. In general, the films which it shows come to East Kilbride about 2-4 weeks after their release in a city like Glasgow but despite this there were still queues to see the film{The Gremlins}on the day that I went. (This queuing is again becoming more common in recent times after a period when no queues were ever seen). I liked the film but when I counted how much I had spent I found that with a Â£1.20 admission and some sweets that I bought inside it was quite expensive
